paper.title: Actions with Indirect Effects (Preliminary Report)

paper.venue: Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning
paper.abstract: Abstract We define and study a high-level language for describing actions that extends the language A introduced by Gelfond and Lifschitz. The new language, AR 0 , allows us to describe actions with indirect effects (ramifications) and simple forms of nondeterminism. A translation from AR 0 into a formalism based on circumscription is proved to be sound and complete.
